website_summaries.verdict: Earns the top spot on our shortlist by surpassing the competition with state-of-the-art performance & design.
cons: We found them somewhat challenging to install, but their quality makes them worth the effort

customer_reviews.title: The wipers were easy to install and they offer a clean wipe
customer_reviews.text: BIG ADVICE (for any replacement) ... put a towel down on the windshield when you replace. I replaced my blades this past week. I took the old blade off and put the naked wiper arm into extension so that I could unbox the new blade. Uhm...the arm didn't catch/lock so it snapped down and shattered my windshield ... in the blink of an eye. I can't blame them though -- that was my fault. The wipers were easy to install and they offer a clean wipe.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Honest

customer_reviews.title: What is Type A and Type B?
customer_reviews.text: A is for Driver and Passenger side. B is for Passenger side ONLY. You can combine A/A or A/B. Type B has extra curve slightly for the passenger side, but Type A will perform as expected.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Lee

customer_reviews.title: **Driver's side 2003 4runner blade**
customer_reviews.text: **Driver's side 2003 4runner blade** Works exactly as it should with no sound or streaking. The other reviewers who complain about these blades need to replace their wiper arm springs which pull the wiper towards the windshield. If this spring is old there is not enough tension for the blade to be flush against the windshield. This causes vibration, sounds, and streaking. For me these wipers work perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect part
customer_reviews.text: Spoke with Bosch tech support. These Amazon provided units come fitted with a wide top lock adapter only so they will NOT fit Audi's which use a narrow top lock. A No. 4 adapter from Bosch is required but is not included in the package. Amazon is mailing out the correct part number but without the "Clear Max 365" logo which indicates the package contains the necessary adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Better than Rain-X Latitude
customer_reviews.text: Don’t hesitate to try these Bosch ICONs. I bought Rain-X Latitude wipers one year ago, and they were OK for awhile, but no matter how much I tried to clean them they still left streaks of junk/water/etc. on my windshield. Bought the Bosch ICONs this week, installed them in a few minutes, and it feels like I have a new windshield. Time will tell how long they will last, but I am very impressed so far. They’re a little more expensive than the Rain-X Latitude but it’s worth it when you don’t have marks on your windshield and they actually clear the water off.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Spies

customer_reviews.title: Good Looks, Alright Performance
customer_reviews.text: I'm replacing this same blade from one year ago and it worked pretty well. I noticed very slight streaking at about 4 months of use but wasn't annoying enough to replace. It's probably the best looking wiper blade I've seen that fits my Scion xA. I put the 24A on the driver's side and a 16A on the passenger side. My favorite thing about this blade is how easy it is to put on and take off compared to every other blade I've used on my car.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R

customer_reviews.title: Only wipers I could find that properly fit a 2014 Nissan Altima
customer_reviews.text: l struggled to find aftermarket wipers that fit my 2014 Altima. The design of the car's wiper arms make it so that the wiper blades are staggered. Due to the HUGE size, all other wipers would not properly lay against the window. The ends would be floating in the air, and it this resulted in terrible performance in the rain. Problem solved! These Bosch wipers are awesome. They are well built and are designed in a way that the spine is more flexible. The 28" wiper lays perfectly against the windshield. I'll be buying more of these in the future. Fantastic wipers.
customer_reviews.author: Wo kommst du

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT fit 2013 Audi Q5
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit 2013 Audi Q5. Amazon states they are compatible, but they have a plastic flange that is too wide to fit in the wiper arm socket (see my pictures).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted much longer than I expected. 100% satisfaction.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on April 26, 2016. It's now Jan 28, 2018 (643 days or 1 year 9 months). I live in Texas, so the heat can be extreme here and usually destroys wiper blades. These blades still work and look fantastic. I actually don't need to replace them, but springtime is coming up and I would rather not have any potential issues. I am so satisfied with these blades that I also bought them for my Toyota Tundra and Chrysler 200. I have gotten the same results and I will always be buying these wiper blades for every car I ever own.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Al

customer_reviews.title: Best wiper blades you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, quiet, streak free, and dead simple to install. I've tried lots of wiper blades, and have never found anything better. For what it's worth, I generally replace wiper blades once a year. However, as an experiment, I wanted to see how long I could go before I absolutely had to replace a pair of these blades. The answer: 6 years. After about 3 or 4 years, they didn't seem to work quite as well, but they were still as good as any other new blades I have tried. Finally, after 6 years, one of the two blades developed a tear. Although YMMV (your mileage may vary), that seems like pretty good longevity to me.
customer_reviews.author: Great918

customer_reviews.title: Best wipers ever!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the wipers in all 3 of my vehicles after testing the Bosch ICONs on one of them. These are the best wipers I've ever used. They keep the windshield cleaner that plain old wipers and they are very quiet because they don't have all the metal parts making noise. High recommend these wipers. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Wiper blade did not fit a 2014 Honda CR-V very securely
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this wiper blade did not fit a 2014 Honda CR-V very securely. The wiper blade will slide into the metal "J" hook, however, unlike the original wiper blade that it is replacing, there is no little locking bump on the wiper blades that will fit into the notch/hole/cutout in the "J" hook that secures the wiper blade in place. You will have to rely on the friction between the metal "J" hook and the plastic as well as the plastic latch that snaps into place over the "J" hook to secure the wiper in place. It will likely work, but I just wish they would have made a version of this wiper blade that has a locking bump.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Gave up on the competitor’s wipers because they were leaving water trails after only a few months that caused frustration in the winter temperatures. These Bosch wipers are a great value, clean the windshield very well, and are still providing the same quality after several months. I plan to switch all of our vehicles to Bosch Icon. I’m sold!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Just like the US mail use to be, Ultra Reliable and form fitting - go out and buy it - don't have to think about it.
customer_reviews.text: Just last 3-4year without fail. The instructions just plain suck on the back, took 2 minutes of Youtube videos to install the system and realized I had the backward on the car - 22 inch should be where the 19 inch and Vice versa. Just some the best, I had AC Delco and Michelin and in two months went back to this brand, it's worth the money - waster so much money at Amazon just for wipers. Don't think about it, just buy it and your windows will clean themselves and outlast the snow. Now Bosch is you need a professional writer to help you with your instructions, I am right here. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. James "Bond" von Richthofen Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an older version of these blades that have been on my car since May 2014. They just now started to break down. I live on Cape Cod in Massachusetts so we have constant salt air and fairly brutal winters, so these will last you in many conditions. These blades fit snug to window and create little to no friction noise. The spine of the blade is flexible as to make them stay contacted with the window. I literally do not have a single streak with these.
customer_reviews.author: Alias Smith

customer_reviews.title: Platinum standard for Focus ST
customer_reviews.text: I walked up to my focus st thinking I knew how to change wiper blades. Not so much but the instructions guided me through. This set is for the ford line up and has the appropriate hardware for 15 focus st. This set has the spoilers located on the right with for our wiper mounting, wiping from the inside up and out. These are the upgraded version that provide superior protection over basic set ups. These last longer and work better from my experience over years of other brands. Living in a rainy climate this are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Slowboogie

customer_reviews.title: pricey but works well
customer_reviews.text: First I ordered cheaper blades and they were not well made and did not perform well on my 2016 CRV- Trashed the plastic junk and bought these Bosch and they are as good or better than the OEM that came from Honda. I'll not go cheap on blade ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: New housing clip took a minute to figure out, but blades are AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Don't recall seeing this type of housing shield covering blade mounting point from Bosch previously, but it only took a minute to figure out. These modern, beam blades get rain out of the way quickly and do not drag rain water as they return across the surface of the glass. Saw these in a windshield wiper shootout on YouTube. Local car parts stores wanted $$$$$ for two blades. Amazon was SIGNIFICANTLY lower in cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmundo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for Audi/VW - BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: doesn't fit. I called the support line which didn't seem to be Bosch (Support Services?). That guy (who questioned my steps, thought/process) then put me in touch with Bosch 855-267-2483. Bosch then said, we'll have a tech support guy call you back... Well, luckily I really nice guy from Bosch called back and explained it all. These are old stock wipers THAT ARE NOT COMPATIBLE WITH AUDI OR VOLKSWAGEN. They pulled them from the stores, but Amazon continues to sell them, despite being told by Bosch not to. ***AUDI/VW owners: DO NOT BUY*** You have to get the ones that say ClearMax 365.
customer_reviews.author: Kman

customer_reviews.title: Despite Amazon and Bosch website DOES NOT FIT AUDI A4
customer_reviews.text: Both sites claim it fits my 2011 A4. But not a single adaptor with it will fit. Closest one is 2 and it's not close. Save yourself time and money avoid these. Also hear Audi/VW moved away from Bosch. So....
customer_reviews.author: Nujackk

customer_reviews.title: 17B doesn't work for a Hummer H2 passenger side
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of Bosch's warranty department. The wipers themselves are fine but I'm going back to Valeo Ultimate--their warranty is probably worse but if you don't need the warranty, does it matter? Valeo 900171B:  Bosch guy says my wiper arm needs replacing... Funny how the 17A works fine on the passenger side, but Bosch guy says my wiper arm needs replacing. Bosch website (screenshot attached) states 17B for the passenger side. This is incorrect. 17A for both sides. Still, they won't honor any warranty /replacement. Just based on this one experience with Bosch, I will always choose another manufacturer option.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wipers, look no further
customer_reviews.text: Used to use Rain-x Latitude wipers on my car, and while they weren't bad, I wanted to see if I could get even better performance. So, after a bit of research and reading a ton of positive reviews, I decided to try out these Bosch ICON wiper blades instead. After putting them to work through a Florida rainy season, I will be switching permanently to these wipers. These wipers hug the windshield good and tight so as to create a nice squeegee effect and produce quality that was noticeably superior to what I was receiving with the Rain-X Latitude wipers. Combine these with a rain-x window treatment and you'll find you have incredibly improved visibility in inclement weather.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Consumer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WINDSHIELD WIPERS THAT LAST LONG!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install onto my 2012 Honda Accord. It fits perfectly and works great! I watched the video under the pictures to see how to install this windshield wiper properly. In addition, I also watched a few Youtube videos on how to remove my original 2012 Honda Accord wipers. Overall, I would highly recommend these wipers to anyone looking for new ones. The 19" one fit perfectly for my 2012 Honda Accord. You will need to buy 2 different sizes to replace both wipers. The passenger side wiper is the 19" and the driver side is the 26". These sizes are for the 2012 Honda Accord LX edition.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Streak out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I have used Icons for years. They have been my go-to and have previously ordered these from Amazon. Never had an issue. I bought a set of 22a and 22b from Amazon. Out of the box the wipers squeak and streak. They only streak under the wiper arm connector which tells me there was a problem with manufacturing. Called Bosch to let them know. They replied they were probably in the warehouse too long and I should return them and buy them locally. OK locally, the price is twice as much and they have big warehouses as well. I will return these to Amazon and buy another product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Holder

customer_reviews.title: Super easy installation
customer_reviews.text: First of all if u are looking foe easy installation wipers, that's the one! Literally took me 5 sec to attach. Pros 1. Easy to open packaging. Your hands is all u need. 2. Super easy installation. 3. Instructions provided on the package itself. 4. Smooth and silent while in action,unlike my previous,sounded as if Lawn mower on my windshield.lol Cons Didn't find any but will see for how long will it last.
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: Great Wipers
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. A lot of my friends recommended Bosch Icon blades and I can see why. Installation was incredibly easy, and the blades clean the windshield way better than I thought they would; blows the OEM wipers out of the water. Literally. The OEM wipers I had just mixed the water around. These ones slap the water off your windshield harder than a pool slapping someone's stomach on a belly flop. 10/10 would windshield wipers with these any day even on sunny days.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Got a bad one but it was dry for a month after getting them.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a set of these for our Honda Civic and Honda Odyssey. 3 of the 4 worked perfectly but the driver side wiper blade on the van leaves puddles in the middle of the window at high speeds. I would of tried to get a replacement but it was pretty dry for first month after we received them and they didn't get much testing in until around Christmas time driving in the snow. I need to get to the store to pickup a blade to replace this one with. Given the price point I don't that I would get these again.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Simply one of the best Wiper Blades made
customer_reviews.text: I have used a large variety of cheap and expensive wiper blade since I bought my first car in 1977. Some were disappointing right out of the box others were good for a few months then degraded to the point of useless. Started using the Bosch brand a few years ago and have been totally happy with the operation and longevity. When I buy a vehicle one of my first tasks is to replace the wiper blades with the Bosch brand regardless if the car is new or used. Nothing irritates me more than a wiper blade that skips or is noisy, Bosch Icon eliminates both of those issues and makes me smile.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good wiper blade
customer_reviews.text: I have used Bosch wiper blades exclusively ever since my first experience with them in 2012. My first set lasted a solid three years of New England winters and probably could have kept on going. They were starting to get a bit streaky but weren't falling apart. I have seen three sets now, between my vehicles and my wife's cars, and we have had great luck with them. They clean the window well for a long time, and even do a good job through the winter of not freezing solid and getting streaky. I also like the improved design of the wiper arm latch mechanism which has a flip up door protecting the joint. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing wipers I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I've never used Bosch wipers before. Always used other brands, but heard they were really good. All I can say is wow am I impressed. I'll never use another brand now and wish I bought them years ago. I bought these for a Nissan Altima and when the wipers are on they are so smooth and quiet you can't even tell they are on. They glide across as if they aren't even touching your glass, but of course are. It takes care of the water as it should, they don't streak and just work perfectly. These might cost a little more then other brands, but they are well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: Updated to Three Stars - Brand new, they streak right after installation.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. Brand new, they streak right after installation. Update: Contacted Bosch. No response after 10 days. Thanks for nothing. Update 2: after a couple weeks Bosche contacted me and offered to send me a new wiper, which they did. They might be a little slow but they do seem to stand by their product. Upgrade to three starts
customer_reviews.author: Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Product
customer_reviews.text: Brand new installed and they leave streaks on the window...I have let them run for a few minutes in the rain hoping everything would fix it self but still horrible streaks..Had to pull over to nearest auto store to replace in the rain because I could not see out my windshield. There is also a two inch gap where the wiper doesn't even touch...just not a quality product for the price paid. Beware these may look like Bosch but from my experience, I have never seen Bosch products perform this horribly...BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Manning

customer_reviews.title: changed for the worst
customer_reviews.text: i've been buying these wipers for years and they have always worked great. this last set i got is totally different. the picture instructions don't match the wipers. after i got them installed they don't work nearly as good either, there's a 3" gap that gets missed in 2 different places when in use. never buying these again. update: changed to 1 star. it was raining today so i turned on my wipers and it just flew off. luckily i hadn't driven off, i can't imagine how dangerous it would be if it came off while driving in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: sploiz

customer_reviews.title: Best blades I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I have a to-do item in an app to replace wiper blades every few months. After installing these, when the time would come, these were still good. So I kept putting it off. and off. and off. Finally, nearly 2 years later, I'm ready for my next set. They've gone up in price, but considering how long they last, they are the most economical blades I've ever purchased!
customer_reviews.author: AndrewTX

customer_reviews.title: These wiper blades do not fit a 2016 Audi TT ...
customer_reviews.text: These wiper blades do not fit a 2016 Audi TT, returning them is costing me and I don't have a box to ship them back in. Amazon matched my car with these blades. These are slide lock blades however my vehicle slide lock does not fit this one, my slide lock wraps around the blade this wiper blade has a ledge that prevents this from sliding in. I've highlighted the difference in red, the blade mechanism doesn't match my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Feaross

customer_reviews.title: So happy with these
customer_reviews.text: These have been on the car for about two months now and so far so good. The ones that I had previously from the dealer were horrible noisy and jittered all over the place unless it was a torrential downpour. These you can flick one wipe across the window even on a dry window and they are perfectly silent. I don’t expect them to last forever but so far these have been fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: MishVMD

customer_reviews.title: I CAN SEE!
customer_reviews.text: Please have got to be some of the best wiper blades I have ever had. They are worth every penny and they are worth the extra few dollars so you are able to see with no streaks. When driving, Visibility is extremely important and I will say it again these blades are worth every penny and I will purchase them again when I need new ones. Buy them. You will not be sorry. I paid full price for these and did not get any discount whatsoever. I am just giving my honest opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Bman1125

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2010 Audi. Bosch Icon 24OE UPC ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit 2010 Audi. Bosch Icon 24OE UPC: 2885103381 is what Amazon sent and it does not fit. Googled it and found Bosch Icon 24OE UPC: 7721215227 does work. Same name different UPC. Bosch Icon 20OE UPC: 2885103378 is what Amazon sent and it does not fit. Bosch Icon 20OE UPC: 7721215224 does work. Same name different UPC. You need to sell them separately.
customer_reviews.author: Gigabyte

customer_reviews.title: Was good for about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: My car is a 2016 Hyundai Sonata. Got these in mid-December 2017 and installed them about a week later. We had couple of snow storms and some cold temps. It's early March and I have to replace them. They've been skidding unless there's a lot of rain, especially when the wipers are going down. They weren't expensive but not cheap either; I'd hoped they'd last longer. Replaced them with similarly priced Rain-X.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my OEM windshield wipers for my Subaru, I was hesitant at first especially about the price, it came down to this or its Michelin or Rain-X competitor. But I figured since I now live in an area with weather I should invest in a quality wiper and I am satisfied the day after i installed we had a pretty big rain storm this wiper did what it was designed to do. It kept my windshield clear and dry, though there is some noise, my OEM were near quiet. Installation of this wiper was painless. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item does not fit the 2015 VW Passat. I recently tried to install this and it is not even close. I ended up buying from dealership and the difference is very noticeable. So Amazon, please change the Fitment of these type wiper blades to "does not fit your vehicle".
customer_reviews.author: Ray Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Best Wiper Blades on the Market.
customer_reviews.text: It's been about a year so it's time for a review. These are what you should consider, not PIAAs. There is a definite reasoning for why I said that. If you're a rich dude that likes to spend, then yeah go for the PIAAs but they're basically the same. The Bosch is still quiet and sturdy after a year later. Just be responsible with it like any other windshield wiper pair and remember to clean it off every two months really. I live in heated conditions, so you can trust me. Lastly, the design seems to be more superior than a lot of other brands too in my opinion. The rubber/soft wipers, the sturdy material, and curvy, expensive look.
customer_reviews.author: TNBT

customer_reviews.title: Best, Longest Lasting Blades!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a "new" (new for us!) Cadillac Escalade Platinum and my wife said we need to replace the blades with the ones I had for her previous car. Looked up my Amazon history and I had bought the Bosch Icon blades nearly 3 years ago and they were still working perfectly on the car we had traded in. Dramatic difference than other blades we have tried. Definitely worth the higher initial cost (amortized due to the longevity it's actually CHEAPER than buying the "cheap" blades). Will only use these blades on our cars. Buy with confidence unless of course you like smeared windshields, streaks and squeaks....in which case buy the competition!
customer_reviews.author: Crokodile

customer_reviews.title: Great, headache-free wipers!
customer_reviews.text: These are simply the best wiper blades I've ever used on my 2001 Suburban, which I've owned for about 15 years. Changing them out literally takes 1-2 minutes; they last a really long time (last replacement was AT LEAST 5 years ago); they cover the entire windshield cleanly, with no jitter or streaks in either direction; they even look good. My only gripe is I had to order from two different Amazon vendors in order to get both left/driver (A) and right/passenger (B) wipers, but both shipped promptly, and I received both on the same day, so, apart from a slight difference in price, no harm, no foul. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Wietstock

customer_reviews.title: works... at first
customer_reviews.text: Initially, it worked great, but it wasn't too long before the entire bottom portion of the windshield is almost untouched, and a telltale black "spaghetti" is flapping around with each wipe. The problem is, pretty much *all* "modern" wiper blades suck just as badly, and have near-zero longevity. I was hoping that a "premium" product (at "premium" price) would last longer, but I guess not. Funny how wiper blades used to last 5yrs or more, and still swipe the windshield fine, but now, with cheaper materials or *something*, they're a yearly purchase at best, sometimes twice-yearly. Or just use Rain-X religiously and hope to not have to use the bleepin' wipers at all. Not happy...
customer_reviews.author: LightBringer

customer_reviews.title: No, they DON'T fit
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT fit 2012 Audi A6, despite Bosch and Amazon both saying they do. Nope. They don't. See photo that compares the genuine OE wiper with the Bosch "OE" replacement..
customer_reviews.author: T. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Best blades I've tried so far, and most expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a number blades over the years on a number of different vehicles. These are close to the best so far. Easily better than the other aftermarket/off brands that I've tried. On par with my 'best' OEM experiences. I can't say they are the best overall because I can't yet speak to their longevity. They are also the most expensive I've tried by a substantial margin. So I am very interested to see how long they stay 'fresh'. If they end up gravely disappointing me, (or remarkably impressing me) over time, I'll update my review accordingly but so far I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Best wiper blades I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Cadillac XTS. Best wiper blades I've ever owned on any car ever. I've never installed blades before but once I figured out it was a breeze. They work amazingly and are quiet, cant believe I've been living my life without these for so long. I've noticed these are always top rated and a common complaint is the price, they're not much more expensive than normal blades and the quality is worth it, I think the investment to have a piece of mind while driving for an extra $10-$20 total is worth it. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Noah B.

customer_reviews.title: Superb Wiper Blades
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these windshield wiper blades to replace the OEM blades on my 2015 Mazda3, which were old and streaking. The difference was night and day. The blades performed better than my OEM blades when they were brand new. They are whisper-quiet, leave no streaks, and work well with rain and snow. They were also easy to install. I've used them for two months now, with no sign of deterioration.
customer_reviews.author: Sam F.

customer_reviews.title: Check your fit
customer_reviews.text: Good blades. I have used these on my cars for years, but this says they fit a 2017 Honda Pilot, and they do, but the manufacturers get the passenger side wrong all the time. They say a 22A fits, and while it does, it's a bit short. You want a 24A for the passenger side on the current gen Honda Pilot.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Must be an engineer to install, instructions are useless
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are useless, you gotta be an engineer to install. I'm pretty mechanically savy, at least I thought. It took me 20 mins to figure out. Once I did I had them on in about a min. SMH
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Atlas
customer_reviews.text: This was listed that it would fit my VW Atlas. The adapter for it just doesn't work. If you look at the photos there is a tab on the wiper arm. Then the only adapter that could work has a wing on the bottom of it that hits the tab. I basically removed the wing so it would slide on. I needed blades and didn't want to mess with a return so..
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Marhefke

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design for clamping onto the arm
customer_reviews.text: I have been replacing wiper blades on cars and trucks for decades and have never come across such a badly designed and poorly built universal blade clamp mechanism. This not really rocket science but the people at Bosch seem to be the rejects from the automotive engineering schools.
customer_reviews.author: WinterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Best wiper blades I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I love these Bosch Icons. This is my second set. I purchased my first set 3 years ago, but I waited until they were starting to not clean well before I replaced them. Like anything made out of rubber and exposed to the elements, they do age. But 3 years ain't bad. Plus, if I replace them more often, I might remember how they install on the wiper arms LOL. It always seems to take me a little while figuring it out, and then once I do, it's real easy. And three years later I forget again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Offmann

customer_reviews.title: The best wiper blades I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I love these Bosch Icons. This is my second set. I purchased my first set 3 years ago, but I waited until they were starting to not clean well before I replaced them. Like anything made out of rubber and exposed to the elements, they do age. But 3 years ain't bad. Plus, if I replace them more often, I might remember how they install on the wiper arms LOL. It always seems to take me a little while figuring it out, and then once I do, it's real easy. And three years later I forget again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Offmann

customer_reviews.title: Good So Far... Jury Still Out!
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to install this set on my Genesis Coupe 2016 (R-Spec) at 29k miles, it didn't fit right cause I put the hook through the wrong part. After I re-installed it again a week later, it worked perfectly. This is a very strange wiper that doesn't use multiple pieces of steel, it "bends" to press against the windshield. Also, the hooks are raised. Which makes me worried that it might damage the springs on my windshield wiper arms. I will report back in a few months about the noise level, and if it wipes water away well. Bosch claims these last "40% longer", we will see.. once I hit ~72k miles! I will admit, they do look stylish.
customer_reviews.author: WeLikeFastCars

customer_reviews.title: It does not fit 2015+ VW GTI.
customer_reviews.text: This wiper does not fit 2015+ VW GTI, even though amazon website said it does. Bosch failed to include clip for it to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Great for my VW GTI!
customer_reviews.text: First important note: these "OE" wipers come with more attachment adapters than the regular "A" wipers and the OE has one that fits my GTI perfectly, while the A does not (however it can be hand hacked to work). Overall, I really like the Bosch Icon wipers - they are great in every important way. I've had several pairs of them over the years. Totally worth paying more for these than other cheaper wipers. * No streaks for a long time * Very quiet * Very long lasting
customer_reviews.author: Yum E.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my VW GTI!
customer_reviews.text: First important note: these "OE" wipers come with more attachment adapters than the regular "A" wipers and the OE has one that fits my GTI perfectly, while the A does not (however it can be hand hacked to work). Overall, I really like the Bosch Icon wipers - they are great in every important way. I've had several pairs of them over the years. Totally worth paying more for these than other cheaper wipers. * No streaks for a long time * Very quiet * Very long lasting
customer_reviews.author: Yum E.

customer_reviews.title: Water lines after wiping.
customer_reviews.text: The first few days after of these wiper blades installed they left "water-lines" after each wipe. I have tried cleaning them and the windshield, but the limes still show. The lines started as a 3-4, but now there are numerous water-lines. To note: the windshield was clear & streak-free after the wipe (except the lines). This was the second pair I have ordered, the first pair lasted around 6 months until this happened too (during wi cold months). I am dissapointed in the quality. I hope they fix this problem with material.
customer_reviews.author: Tbone

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit my vehicle, Bosch is wrong
customer_reviews.text: I’m a loyal Bosch auto parts buyer. Their products are awesome. So I used their parts finder to purchase ICONS for my 2019 Jetta (19 & 24 OE) but they didn’t fit. People at Advanced Auto Parts confirmed these are supposed to fit according to their parts finder but aren’t able to be installed. I called Bosch support and they said these are an old model with the same part number, so they don’t fit despite being the correct part number to order. The return window closed and Bosch support hasn’t helped by sending adapters though they said they would. I’ll be buying Trico’s from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: 2006 BMW X5
customer_reviews.text: These wipers work great but the passenger side wiper doesn't sit all the way across the glass when it's resting. They still work, they're just a bit unsightly. See the pic below. Also, if you are buying these for a BMW X5, remember to remove the clip under the wiper arm or you will notice a big spot in the middle of the windshield not being wiped.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson!

customer_reviews.title: THE wiper blade to buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Bosch ICON on all of my cars for the last decade and have never looked back. They outperform standard wiper blades and imitations of this style and last a lot longer than you would imagine. These wiper blades will easily last over a year on a daily driver. Very rarely during long load trips in extremely wet snowy conditions have they collected snow on the ends of the blade and keep them for wiping clean. Simple installation on most vehicles without manufacturer specific connections. The housing that attaches to the wiper arm clicks closed over the arm, ensuring that the blades will not fly off when in use. Use these once and you will never look back.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Blades, Great Deal, Great Minimal Packaging
customer_reviews.text: In my experience, these are the best and longest lasting wiper blades out there. I replace them once a year and they're still in decent shape when I do. This set is alsi a great deal, and it comes with the added bonus of minimal packaging. Everything is in recyclable cardboard with no plastic inserts, etc. It's a lot less junk than buying them individually.
customer_reviews.author: Brickbat70

customer_reviews.title: Fine blades except for snow and ice
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair for my front wipers 2008 Prius in November, 2017. Easy to install, worked great - probably the best blades I've had on that car including OEM-until it snowed. They really can't handle the snow or ice well. I guess I'll have to spring for a pair of winter blades this year. BTW I've had none of the streaking problems other reviewers complain of. A good way to prevent streaking is to occasionally clean your windshield with a 50/50 solution of water and vinegar. Dry with newspaper, puts a nice polish on the windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Tom from CT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and performance
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd write a review for windshield wipers... Until I tried another brand. I've largely bought Bosch blades, but they aren't the cheapest. I tried RainX with a lot of marketing hype on the box and were slightly less expensive. I left them on for a couple of weeks and tossed them after consistent smearing on the windshield. I don't know what else to say other than these things just work. You shouldn't have to think about windshield wipers and with Bosch, you don't. You forget they're there. Buy a cheaper brand and you'll be reminded.
customer_reviews.author: IceMan

customer_reviews.title: Love the convenience of ordering as a set, and both fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Used the provided chart for size selection. Everything fit perfectly, and it was nice to have them arrive as a set. The installation instructions on the enclosure were easy to follow, and the plastic parts seem durable. I think these will last quite a while (even with Florida sun) and get the job done that's intended. I've already driven through several rains (one a bit extreme) and they worked VERY well keeping my windshield clear. Easy to recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Don Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not for cars with outward-opening wipers!
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: All ICON series blades don't put their "spoiler" in the right orientation for opposing-action windshield wipers (i.e. the ones that go outward from center). Even though the A/B denotes the Driver/Passenger side of the windshield, this is just insofar as the curvature of the blade is concerned. The blade will still install on the wiper arm, however, the lip will be oriented the opposite direction of the Driver's side. If you have a car like this (for instance, our 2013 Honda Civic sedan), it's best to go for the Evolution series. The Evolutions are the same technology, basically, without the asymmetric lip.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Work great on my Mazda CX-5
customer_reviews.text: My OEM wipers lasted 4 years, but I should have replaced them with these Bosch ICONs after 3. They work great in keeping my windshield clean. Yes, they are a little more expensive than other wiper blades, but a clean windshield is worth it. I use these wipers on all of my vehicles now.
customer_reviews.author: Bookfan

customer_reviews.title: Best wipers i have had so far
customer_reviews.text: I went to autozone for replacement wipers and discovered they are more than expensive for trucks! I have a grand Cherokee and i needed to buy 3 wipers and stumbled across these! I had a checklist of things i needed from my new wipers! 1. Steady swipes 2. No noise when operating, and 3 longevity.. so far they are perfect I’ve even recommended to my mother who has a crossover to get these when it’s time to replace.. they work better than my old factory wipers and the Goodyear wipers i have on my car
customer_reviews.author: Kai Renee

customer_reviews.title: Fit Okay but all plastic construction except actual blade
customer_reviews.text: Both blades arrived on time and in sturdy product packaging as well as good quality shipping box. I really thought with the Bosch name these would be quality construction. The Honda brand mounts these replaced were all metal, these are plastic and the insert that attaches blade mount housing to wiper arm on vehicle is very thin plastic. The rubber blades are impressive, much wider surface against glass than factory originals. The installation procedure is nothing like Bosch video on YouTube but I finally got all the pieces to snap together. With the plastic construction, I doubt these arms will last more than one hot Texas summer.
customer_reviews.author: SJS Dallas

customer_reviews.title: These make for excellent wipers but they don't take the heat well
customer_reviews.text: These make for good wipers but they don't take the heat that well at all. It only takes months before they stiffen enough to make all sorts of noise across your windshield as you use them during a nice rain. So not great for desert regions like Nevada or Arizona. They most likely work pretty well everywhere else though. For the hot spots though, just stick with Rain X or something. At least they are more affordable and can be easier to work with (not that these are that bad to install).
customer_reviews.author: Poc Network // Tech

customer_reviews.title: Streaky blades
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible blades. They leave streaks as they wipe. I initially thought that this might be due to junk collecting on the blade, eg., pollen, leaf debris, etc. So I would periodically wipe the blade vigorously. It did nothing to improve performance. I have used Bosch products for decades. That use to be a guarantee of high performance. But I suspect that Bosch is cheapening their brand. These are probably made in China - not by "elves in the Black Forest" as in the good old days. These blades are high priced junk.
customer_reviews.author: MoJo

customer_reviews.title: Bosch - Best
customer_reviews.text: I am like most, I think I am anyway. I want an excellent product for the best price and one that will be delivered quickly (1-3 days). I have tried three different brands of wiper blades. I personally want the best. Bosch last a good six months for me (Central Florida). What I liked best about this deal is that both, driver and passenger side blades cam in the deal. Ninety percent of the time it would be two purchases as today many vehicles have different sizes for each side.
customer_reviews.author: skeye

customer_reviews.title: How can they sell these?
customer_reviews.text: I bought a relatively new loaded Honda Odyssey and bought a pair of these because they are suppose to be the best. They looked perfect, went on as most all wipers do. But they streak so badly that I think I have to throw them away. I don't understand how they can be this bad. I have wiped them down, scrubbed the windshield, made sure there is no debris. These aren't even usable. They look like genuine Bosch wipers. I bought both a left and right wiper which are different sizes, but they are equally awful.
customer_reviews.author: melinda b ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Streaks after 3 months: virtually un-used.
customer_reviews.text: I googled best wipers and came across this one for extreme weather longevity. Turned out to be a big disappointment. 3 months (July - Sept) after purchase the wipers started streaking. I only used the vehicle for 1 of the 3 months and during that one month it rained for about only a couple of days. My 'investment' in these more expensive wipers were a total fail!!
customer_reviews.author: Farmer

customer_reviews.title: They were incredibly easy to install (about 40 seconds) and they are incredibly ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these wipers. We live in Portland which has had a miserable winter filled with a plethora of weather conditions such as snow, ice, freezing rain, slush - you name it. I did my research and opted for these with hopes of doing a better-than-average job and that have exceeded my expectations. They were incredibly easy to install (about 40 seconds) and they are incredibly quiet, something I wasn't expecting compared to the factory wipers I've had. I love these things and highly recommend them for quality, ease of installation, and excellent performance.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: This is good except that they nick easily
customer_reviews.text: These are very soft. This is good except that they nick easily. Once nicked, they will make streaks the entire arc of the sweep. Mine lasted one season without nicks. After that, the tiniest bit of plant material stuck on the windshield caused nicking. Over the next season multiple nicks, so the wipers are great in places but leave 4-5 streaks on the sweep. I garage my vehicle and don't put that many miles on it so expect good wipers to last 4+ years, not 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Ottokrat

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: My wipers were only 5 months old, the stock ones, and they were already annoying. Leaving streaks behind, juddery, just not working well. I looked for what would fit my new JL Wrangler, and these came up. Lots of positive reviews, so I figured I'd give them a shot. More streaks left behind by these than the 5 month old stock ones. They don't judder and stutter along like the stock ones did at least, and make less noise, but they just don't do well cleaning water or any dirt tossed up with wheel splash from the windows... I'll have to keep looking for a good wiper option.
customer_reviews.author: LegoDadTop Contributor: Architecture

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit Beetle 2016
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend buying. While it advertises as fitting VW Beetle 2016 (in photo), this is not true. The way this wiper supports different types of car is through adapters. And one type of the adapters is missing from both wipers I received. Also, the pairs of wiper I received did not look the same. It looked like they were two different versions, or even two different brands.. It could have been a stock mixups and I could have received used/returned items. I can't be sure of that. I have since returned these wipers, but it created a shipping hassle especially during Covid-19 time. I almost missed my return window.
customer_reviews.author: Gant

customer_reviews.title: Bosch 22B Not A Fit for the Passenger Side of My 2005 Tahoe.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the Bosch 22B does not wipe the passenger side entire surface - a triangular area about 3" x 5" is missed. Looking at the installed wiper it is obvious that the blade is not touching the windshield at the outer edge. In my experience, this blade does not fit the 05 Tahoe.
customer_reviews.author: William Baker

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, but not perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my BMW x3 (2018). The instructions were a little difficult to understand, (at least for me, who doesn't normally do anything to their cars). You need to switch out the connector based on what is on your car now. Once you get the correct connector, the installation is very fast! Now, the lower part of the longer wiper makes a vibration sound (and visible too) when it's just drizzling rain. When it pours, theres no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen

customer_reviews.title: Best and Longest Lasting Wiper Blade on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on January 16, 2016 and recoded the video on January 11, 2018. After over 2 years (still on the car at the time of this review) of enduring the Florida heat, intense thunderstorms, and freezing weather (yes, it will drop into the 20s in the Daytona Beach area), these blades are still performing amazing. There are little streaks that have just recently formed, but no jumping or skipping. Haven't had a wiper blade perform nearly as good for as long as these did. Install was super easy and they look very nice on the car. Highly recommend and will purchase another pair of Icons when these finally give up.!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, not what I am used to with this brand
customer_reviews.text: I have used Bosch ICON wipers for years and they are on all of my vehicles. I replaced the 2 year old OEM wipers with this set about 2 months ago. They have been a complete disappointment, they seem to wipe fine in one direction but not in the other and just smear the water. This is unacceptable after 2 months, especially since I am paying a premium price for these wipers. I am due to replace some other ones but I am seriously reconsidering my relationship with these wipers when there are so many cheaper options available.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Rice

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I did the appropriate research on wipers
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I did the appropriate research on wipers. So many versions out there (do not try the Rain-X ones - they streak) - over the weekend we had sleet and freezing rain, and at my house on top of that, from the wind, a nice layer of pine needles laying on top of the wiper against the window (this is why I upgraded my 2017 Sorento wipers - the needles would get stuck under the blades like you wouldn't believe and then damage the blades). The wipers performed flawlessly - even while there was ice hardened to them!
customer_reviews.author: Hochimin

customer_reviews.title: Great efficient wipers
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my BMW X3 here in Florida when you can expect a rainstorm everyday around 3 pm in rainy season. These are the best wipers I have ever found
customer_reviews.author: SW Florida

customer_reviews.title: giving me excellent cleaning, even when salty road water is being ...
customer_reviews.text: These are incredible wipers! After the typical "crap, I need new wipers on this snowy, salty day" experience, I ordered these immediately. Two days later and after a simple installation, I'm really, really impressed. Compared to the OEM-style wipers that I always used, this style wiper applies a lot of force to the windshield, giving me excellent cleaning, even when salty road water is being thrown onto my windshield from the traffic ahead. I'm glad that I can finally shop for quality instead of seeking the lowest price. These wipers aren't life changing, but you'll feel like they are the first time you use them.
customer_reviews.author: balthisar

customer_reviews.title: They are almost silent when in use
customer_reviews.text: These are the most expensive wiper blades that I have purchased. It was probably more than was necessary because I only need to be concerned about rain. However, I wanted to see if they really did last longer than other premium brands. I'll need to keep them for at least another 6-8 months before I can make that assessment, but I'm impressed so far. There is absolutely no streaking, and they are the quietest wipers I've ever owned in any vehicle. I'll try to update this review if they sustain the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon H

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: These wipers have been my go to wiper for years. Every once in a while I will try a rainx or other brand if I am in a pinch, but I always come back. Install is a breeze and warranty is fantastic! To all you reviewers that blame Amazon for something not fitting your car, DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH!! Amazon is not an auto parts store, find out what you need directly from the brand you plan to get or from the manufacturer, THEN come back to Amazon and make your purchase. Stop being those type of people that go through life blaming someone else for their own mistakes!
customer_reviews.author: .0001 Dad

customer_reviews.title: Better that OEM  The ICON line is the best Bosch has to offer
customer_reviews.text: Here in Florida the sun beats our wiper blades very quickly, we really depend on them as we get heavy rain all the time. These hold up the longest, and do the best job without scratching the window. The ICON line is the best Bosch has to offer, Mine hold up for three years in the baking sun. Just wipe the blade from time to time, and if you live in a dusty area get a sprayer to wet your window before using the built in sprayer. Does a better job, and protects the window.
customer_reviews.author: DaPoppa1

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I live in central NC and we have winters with temps in the teens and summers with temps in the high 80s. I bought by Bosch Icon 22A&22B wiper blades for a Chevy Silverado 3500 in April of 2017. They are just now showing a bit of streaking. Most advice on wiper blades is to replace them every 6 to 12 months. One place said a premium blade will last about two years. Mine have lasted three. And they have performed flawlessly for those three years.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Hofford

customer_reviews.title: not fit 2018 BMW X3
customer_reviews.text: the reason i buy this is because Amazon website cfm it fit my 2018 BMW X3. but end up it does not fit at all. so i return it and i need to pay $5 shipping??? why?? if i know it will not fit my can, i will not buy it. also the seller mention restocking fee(20%)???
customer_reviews.author: SAI KIT YUEN

customer_reviews.title: Better Than OEM Wipers
customer_reviews.text: These wipers by Bosch are amazing. These are replacing factor direct wipers obtained from the Toyota dealership about 10 months ago. the factory wipers made so much noise. These new wipers are ninja silent. they keep the windshield so much clearer than the OEM wipers. The design of these wipers allow the blades to precisely fit your windshield. Installing was literally a snap. Nothing to do bu snap into place. When these wear, I will replace with exact ones if still being made.
customer_reviews.author: V Kool

customer_reviews.title: Short-lived
customer_reviews.text: This style is supposed to be better for snow climates, but compared to other brands I was a bit disappointed. I am usually able to go two years on an outside vehicle, but these lasted only about 8 months before they began squeaking and streaking, even with an observed smooth edge. Fyi, I never ran them over ice. The clearing when new was not quite as good as others leaving a small streak on the passing stroke. Install could not have been easier and they stay in place their entire lifespan. I bought them again so we'll see how long the second batch lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Bongo

customer_reviews.title: ICE STORM PROVEN.  Made it through 3 hour ICE Storm
customer_reviews.text: I just made it through a 3 hour ice storm driving through Iowa and Illinois. These wiper blades never failed and they were about 4 months old. I kept my defroster on and opened my back window just a bit to get more airflow for the defroster. other people were pulling off the road to clear there wiper blades and i just kept on driving. I knew these were good wiper blades but this just proved how good they really are. these last very long than anything walmart has
customer_reviews.author: C5Galaxy

customer_reviews.title: Not As Good As expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these with bad weather in the forecast. They do not provide a clean wipe. I use Rain X windshield solvent which has always been great in Chicago high salt winters. But these leave streaks of salt on the windshield unless you use a massive amount of windshield washer. Also they are noisy like finger nails on a chalk board. Will never buy again especially at this price point. I spent the extra money for a premium wiper and got just mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie P.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was time to replace my old wipers that I bought from Lexus for $50. I refused to spend that much again so I bought the Bosch. When it rained for the first time as the wiper went up it looked like it fogged the window. Going down most of the “fog”went away. Upon closer inspection I saw that the fog were tiny streaks. I should have tried to return them but I lived with them suffering. I took them off and cleaned my old Lexus wipers and they are much better than the Bosch.
customer_reviews.author: Shrink

customer_reviews.title: The best wiper blades for the money. PNW tested and they’re tried and true.
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best blades I’ve used. After I bought my first set of icons, I’ve put them on every single car I’ve owned when it came time to replace the old ones. I’ve recommended them to my friends and family. These are superb. From living in Oregon where good blades are a must, I wouldn’t recommend any other brand. Even with heavy use they last for a long time. Install is a breeze. Even non car people should get them on in a couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit short about an inch or two from previous proper sized wipers for my 2013 Toyota Camry 26A and 18A are a bit short. I recommend buying a size above that. Bought these because rated as best wiper type overall. Quiet and wipe window well. No way to tell how long they actually last but everybody else seems happy. Can be tricky to install if you have no brain like me. Haha
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance, Acceptable Lifespan for Harsh Conditions
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Bosch windshield wipers on my 2013 BMW F30 Sedan for the past few years. They are extremely easy to install, and the performance is unbeatable when new. They are very quiet and effective at clearing the windshield of water and debris. I replace my windshield wipers about once per year - this may be a bit more frequently than necessary; however, I don't like skimping on safety. If you feel the same way, get these, replace them yearly, and enjoy top tier performance!
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

product_meta.title: Bosch ICON 26A Wiper Blade, Up to 40% Longer Life - 26" (Pack of 1)
product_meta.description: Size:26A| Style:Pack of 1Bosch bracketless wiper blades are designed without brackets or hinges, offering improved design and performance over conventional wiper blades. The award-winning design of Bosch ICON distributes more uniform pressure along the entire length of the blade for ultimate all-season performance that lasts up to 40% longer than other premium wiper blades. The integrated wind spoiler design increases the down force on the wiper blade to prevent lift-off at highway speeds. The bracketless design and enclosed tension springs provide superior wiping performance in all weather conditions. Bosch ICON blades are the best you can buy!
feature_bullets: Patented beam design with shielded connector optimizes visibility even under extreme weather conditions
Exclusive tension spring arcing technology creates a fit that’s custom-contoured to the curvature of each side of the windshield
Exclusive fx dual rubber resists heat and ozone deterioration and proven to last up to 40% longer than other premium wiper blades
Easy installation with original equipment-quality hook adapter (Hook arm 9x3 & 9x4)
Flexible asymmetric spoiler distributes uniform downward force along the entire blade to hold it firmly to the windshield at higher speeds

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars21,809 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
